page.title: 20Pollution
page.content: In this beautiful part of the Cotswolds there are several things which pollute the area. The most noticeable pollutant is aircraft noise. Aircraft from at least five different bases overfly the area. When Concorde was being developed at Fairford the noise was deafening though the plane was a stunning sight. This kind of pollution, although disturbing when it occurs, only lasts for a short while. A far more sinister form of pollution which affects the whole of this county are the gases which come from the Avonmouth industrial complex sixty kilometres away.Tests carried out in Hatherop show the presence of sulphur dioxide in the air.
